article.headline: Buffalo 69, Siena 64
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Eric Moore scored 18 points, including 11 in the second half, to lead Buffalo to a 69-64 comeback win over Siena on Saturday. A dunk by Siena's Edwin Ubiles left Buffalo (8-5) trailing 47-35 with 15:55 left in the second half. But the Bulls responded with a 21-0 run capped by Calvin Betts' 3-pointer with 9:11 remaining, taking a 56-47 lead. Siena (5-4) was held scoreless for over seven minutes as Buffalo scored on seven straight possessions and grabbed six offensive rebounds. The Saints, who saw a 3-game winning streak snapped, had two opportunities to tie with less than a minute remaining but 3-pointers by Ronald Moore and Kenny Hasbrouck missed. Michael Haddix and Moore each had 14 points for Siena. Ubiles finished with 12 points. Ronald Moore added eight assists. Parnell Smith shot 7-for-10 from the field and added 18 points for Buffalo with five offensive rebounds. Betts finished with 10 points and 11 rebounds. Buffalo's leading scorer and rebounder, Yassin Idbihi, missed his third-straight game with an elbow injury. Buffalo has trailed during the second half in six of their eight wins.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
